1 \defgroup session-connection-settings Session Connection Settings
2 \ingroup scheduler
3 
4 \details
5 
6 Session Scheduler exposes the OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings class
7 to define the connection related parameters, required to establish the FIXP session successfully.
8 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings class is targeted to provide
9 users with a handy way of defining connection-related parameters for sessions appropriately.
10 
11 \section connection-settings Defining Connection Settings for Sessions
12 
13 When a session is connected, at least hostname and TCP
14 port of the counterparty must be specified. For this reason, all constructors of the
15 OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings class require counterparty
16 hostname and TCP port parameters.
17 
18 \snippet SessionScheduler.cpp SessionConnectionSettings1
19 
20 Sometimes a session's counterparty may be out of service, causing session logon failure.
21 B3 systems provide secondary servers, which can be connected while primary servers are down.
22 To support such cases, OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings class exposes the
23 OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings::addCounterparty member, which allows
24 defining secondary servers, that will be connected in case of the connection failure to the
25 primary server. Also, Scheduler remembers last good connection settings (counterparty).
26 Therefore, since the next time connection must be established, it will use the last good configuration.
27 
28 \snippet SessionScheduler.cpp SessionConnectionSettings2
